Can you write a Python script that calculates the age of Mozart when he composed his Symphony No. 41? Here are the relevant details:
- Mozart was born on January 27th, 1756
- He composed Symphony No. 41 in 1788
- Symphony No. 41 is believed to have been completed when Mozart was in his mid-30s
Please include the Python code that you would use to calculate Mozart's age when he composed Symphony No. 41.

Certainly! To calculate Mozart's age when he composed Symphony No. 41, we can simply determine the difference in years between the year he composed the symphony (1788) and his birth year (1756). Here's how you can do it in Python:

```python
from datetime import datetime

# Mozart's birthdate
birth_date = datetime(1756, 1, 27)

# Year when Symphony No. 41 was composed
composition_year = 1788

# Calculate age
age = composition_year - birth_date.year

print(f"Mozart was {age} years old when he composed Symphony No. 41.")
```

This script will output:

```
Mozart was 32 years old when he composed Symphony No. 41.
```

This calculation is straightforward as we are only considering the years and not the specific months or days within those years. Since Symphony No. 41 was completed in 1788 and Mozart was born in 1756, Mozart was indeed in his early 30s, specifically 32 years old, when he completed the symphony.
